[tags]: 
Finding significant changepoints using Segneigh method

I am analyzing changes in the data set in time as mentioned below. To find significant changepoints in time, I am using the 'changepoint package', cptmeanvar function, SegNeigh method, and AIC as the penalty. It gives a maximum of 129 changepoints and the number varies with different values of the Q parameter. Is this method and penalty type suitable for the given data set? I tried constructing an elbow plot to optimize the number of changepoints, however, it didn't work. Are all changepoints thus obtained significant? Is there any other way (except the elbow plot) to narrow down the significant change points? Data: YEAR JUN JUL AUG SEP 1871 2223 3871 2856 2980 1872 2340 3210 2885 1958 1873 609 3843 2580 1714 1874 2722 3186 3362 2323 1875 1594 3344 2958 2413 1876 960 3222 2396 2391 1877 1054 1989 1871 1230 2014 826 3143 2452 1686 2015 1544 2622 2222 1036 2016 1185 3290 2539 2156 My code: library(changepoint) library(TSstudio) #tseries is the time series of the data provided ts.seg=cpt.meanvar(tseries,method="SegNeigh",Q=130, penalty='AIC') ts.seg cpts(ts.seg) plot(ts.seg) plot(ts.seg,diagnostic=TRUE)
